column4: why would the ubuntu install freeze on the Partitions formatting part at 33%?
could be anything really
it does it every time, sometimes it just sticks - other times it finishes and throws an error that's so bland it could mean dang near anything
did you try gparted?
gparted?
you can run it from a livecd
http://gparted.sourceforge.net/livecd.php
so it's a diff os?
it is possible that program gives you a better error or it will just work
it's linux with the gparted program on it
you can try it with that instead of the Ubuntu installer
ok
i have to keep formatting the hd every time the install fails [7 times so far]
could low battery be a potential issue?
as in issue that would mess up the install
don't think so
idk then
I'd say try it with the livecd
alright
so gparted is like an alternate ubuntu installer?
no it is a harddrive partitioning program
